org.neo4j.driver.v1

Interface Driver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public interface Driver
extends AutoCloseable
    Accessor for a specific Neo4j graph database.

    Driver implementations are typically thread-safe, act as a template for Session creation and host a connection pool. All configuration and authentication settings are held immutably by the Driver. Should different settings be required, a new Driver instance should be created.

    A driver maintains a connection pool for each remote Neo4j server. Therefore the most efficient way to make use of a Driver is to use the same instance across the application.

    To construct a new Driver, use one of the GraphDatabase.driver methods. The URI passed to this method determines the type of Driver created.

    URI SchemeDriver
    bolt Direct driver: connects directly to the host and port specified in the URI.
    bolt+routing Routing driver: can automatically discover members of a Causal Cluster and route sessions based on AccessMode.
    Since:
    1.0 (bolt+routing URIs since 1.1)

    • Method Detail

      • isEncrypted

        boolean isEncrypted()
        Return a flag to indicate whether or not encryption is used for this driver.
        Returns:
        true if the driver requires encryption, false otherwise

      • session

        Session session()
        Create a new general purpose Session.

        Alias to session(AccessMode.WRITE, null).

        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • session

        Session session(AccessMode mode)
        Create a new Session for a specific type of work.

        Alias to session(mode, null).

        Parameters:
        mode - the type of access required by units of work in this session, e.g. read access or write access.
        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • session

        Session session(String bookmark)
        Create a new write Session with the specified initial bookmark. First transaction in the created session will ensure that server hosting is at least as up-to-date as the transaction referenced by the supplied bookmark.

        Alias to session(AccessMode.WRITE, bookmark).

        Parameters:
        bookmark - the initial reference to some previous transaction. A null value is permitted, and indicates that the bookmark does not exist or is unknown.
        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • session

        Session session(AccessMode mode,
                String bookmark)
        Create a new Session for a specific type of work with the specified initial bookmark. First transaction in the created session will ensure that server hosting is at least as up-to-date as the transaction referenced by the supplied bookmark.
        Parameters:
        mode - the type of access required by units of work in this session, e.g. read access or write access.
        bookmark - the initial reference to some previous transaction. A null value is permitted, and indicates that the bookmark does not exist or is unknown.
        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • session

        Session session(Iterable<String> bookmarks)
        Create a new write Session with specified initial bookmarks. First transaction in the created session will ensure that server hosting is at least as up-to-date as the latest transaction referenced by the supplied iterable of bookmarks.

        Alias to session(AccessMode.WRITE, bookmarks).

        Parameters:
        bookmarks - initial references to some previous transactions. Both null value and empty iterable are permitted, and indicate that the bookmarks do not exist or are unknown.
        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • session

        Session session(AccessMode mode,
                Iterable<String> bookmarks)
        Create a new write Session with specified initial bookmarks. First transaction in the created session will ensure that server hosting is at least as up-to-date as the latest transaction referenced by the supplied iterable of bookmarks.

        Alias to session(AccessMode.WRITE, bookmarks).

        Parameters:
        mode - the type of access required by units of work in this session, e.g. read access or write access.
        bookmarks - initial references to some previous transactions. Both null value and empty iterable are permitted, and indicate that the bookmarks do not exist or are unknown.
        Returns:
        a new Session object.

      • close

        void close()
        Close all the resources assigned to this driver, including open connections and IO threads.

        This operation works the same way as closeAsync() but blocks until all resources are closed.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • closeAsync

        CompletionStage<Void> closeAsync()
        Close all the resources assigned to this driver, including open connections and IO threads.

        This operation is asynchronous and returns a CompletionStage. This stage is completed with null when all resources are closed. It is completed exceptionally if termination fails.

        Returns:
        a completion stage that represents the asynchronous close.
